Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees, Secretary-Treasurer's Files
International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees and Moving Picture Machine Operators of the United States and Canada
WAG.058
20 Linear Feet (20 boxes)
circa 1950s-1980s The International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employes, Moving Picture Technicians, Artists and Allied Crafts of the United States and Canada (better known as IATSE) is a union of workers in the entertainment industry. Originally composed of stage hands and projectionists, IATSE now represents craftspeople in a broad array of related occupations.
This collection consists of IATSE contracts submitted to the Secretary Treasurer of IATSE. The contracts are organized by local number.
Access Restrictions
Open for research without restrictions. NOTE: This collection is housed offsite and advance notice is required for use.
Arrangement
This collection is unprocessed.
Historical/Biographical Note
The International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employes, Moving Picture Technicians, Artists and Allied Crafts of the United States and Canada (better known as IATSE) is a union of workers in the entertainment industry. Originally composed of stage hands and projectionists, IATSE now represents craftspeople in a broad array of related occupations.
Scope and Content Note
This collection consists of IATSE contracts submitted to the Secretary Treasurer of IATSE. The contracts are organized by local number.
Use Restrictions
Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:
Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Elmer Holmes Bobst Library

New York, NY 10012
